source_caption_data.pre_caption:
This breathtaking night scene showcases the vibrant green aurora borealis illuminating a starry sky. A tall, snow-dusted evergreen tree stands prominently in the center of the frame, rising from a snowy landscape dotted with a forest of other pines.

This is a time-lapse video. The aurora and clouds can be seen moving across the sky.
source_caption_data.pre_caption_prompt: The video is a scenery shot. You do not need to describe the subject motion. Just note that briefly in one to three sentences.
source_caption_data.final_caption:
This breathtaking night scene showcases the vibrant green aurora borealis illuminating a starry sky. A tall, snow-dusted evergreen tree stands prominently in the center of the frame, rising from a snowy landscape dotted with a forest of other pines.

This is a time-lapse video. The aurora and clouds can be seen moving across the sky.

generated_critique: The provided caption fails to describe the subject's motion, which is the central requirement of the instructions, especially for a time-lapse video. Instead of detailing the movement of the aurora and clouds, the caption focuses entirely on describing a static scene, mentioning the "tall, snow-dusted evergreen tree" and "snowy landscape," which are stationary elements. The caption also violates the instruction to avoid emotional adjectives by using the word "breathtaking." A more accurate description would focus on the dynamic elements. For instance, you could have described how the green aurora borealis first appears as a faint arc, then intensifies, shimmering and pulsing in vertical waves as it drifts across the upper portion of the frame from right to left. You could also have mentioned the secondary motion of scattered clouds scudding quickly across the lower sky, partially obscuring the stars as they pass, while the foreground trees and landscape remain fixed.
revised_caption_by_generated_critique: This time-lapse video captures the dynamic movement of the aurora borealis and clouds across a starry sky. The green aurora first appears as a faint arc, then intensifies, shimmering and pulsing in vertical waves as it drifts from right to left. Meanwhile, scattered clouds scud quickly across the lower sky, partially obscuring the stars as they pass, while the tall, snow-dusted evergreen tree and snowy landscape remain stationary in the foreground.
